titles.title: To express the sense of Congress regarding regulation of mercury hazardous waste, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E2352-2353)

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Transportation and Hazardous Materials.

bill.summary: 11/29/1994--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the Environmental Protection Agency should not exempt mercury hazardous wastes from hazardous waste regulation but should adopt waste management policies and rules that seek to minimize all releases of mercury into the environment while encouraging the recycling of mercury-containing fluorescent lamps and other mercury-containing devices.
